name: Zara Larsson
description:
'''Zara Maria Larsson''' ({{IPA|sv|ˈsɑ̂ːra ˈlɑ̌ːʂɔn|lang|sv-Zara Larsson.ogg}}; born 16 December 1997) is a Swedish singer and songwriter. She first rose to prominence in 2008 after winning the [[Talang 2008|second season]] of ''[[Talang (Swedish TV show)|Talang]]'', the Swedish version of the ''[[Got Talent]]'' format. In 2012, Larsson signed with the record label [[TEN Music Group]] and subsequently released her debut [[extended play]] (EP), ''[[Introducing (EP)|Introducing]],'' in January 2013. The EP was supported by Larsson's first original single, "[[Uncover (song)|Uncover]]", which charted at number one in Sweden and Norway, being certified [[Music recording certification|6× Platinum]] in the former. Her debut studio album, ''[[1 (Zara Larsson album)|1]]'', saw a limited release in Sweden, Denmark and Norway in 2014, and contains the Swedish top-ten singles "[[Carry You Home (Zara Larsson song)|Carry You Home]]" and "[[Rooftop (song)|Rooftop]]".

After her success in Scandinavia, Larsson signed a three-year contract with [[Epic Records]] in the United States. Her debut international album and second overall, ''[[So Good (Zara Larsson album)|So Good]],'' was released in March 2017. It became her second number one album in Sweden, while charting in the top ten in multiple other countries, and at number 26 on the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. The album's lead single, "[[Lush Life (Zara Larsson song)|Lush Life]]", reached the top five on [[record chart]]s in 18 countries, and became one of the best selling songs of the 2010s in the United Kingdom. Other commercially successful singles from the album include "[[Never Forget You (Zara Larsson and MNEK song)|Never Forget You]]" (with [[MNEK]]), "[[Ain't My Fault]]", "[[I Would Like]]", and "[[So Good (Zara Larsson song)|So Good]]". Larsson's third studio album, the [[Nordic popular music|Scandipop]]-influenced ''[[Poster Girl (album)|Poster Girl]],'' followed in March 2021, led by the single "[[Ruin My Life]]", which earned [[List of music recording certifications|certifications]] in nine countries. The album's third single, "[[Wow (Zara Larsson song)|Wow]]", was certified Gold in the United States, and spawned a remix with American singer [[Sabrina Carpenter]].

In June 2022, Larsson left TEN Music Group and acquired her music catalogue. Her fourth studio album, ''[[Venus (Zara Larsson album)|Venus]]'', was released in February 2024 under Epic Records and her own label, Sommer House, and explored [[dance-pop]] and [[euro-pop]]. The album's singles "[[Can't Tame Her]]" and "[[On My Love]]" (with [[David Guetta]]), achieved commercial success, being certified Gold or Platinum in numerous countries. Larsson's fifth studio album, ''[[Midnight Sun (Zara Larsson album)|Midnight Sun]]'', was released on 26 September 2025 to widespread critical acclaim. Its [[Midnight Sun (Zara Larsson song)|title track]] earned Larsson her first [[Grammy Award]] nomination for [[Grammy Award for Best Dance Pop Recording|Best Dance Pop Recording]].
